cellularAutomata
Class CAController

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.CAController

public class CAController
extends java.lang.Object

Controls moment by moment actions of the CA, as directed by user input from the graphics. Uses singleton pattern so that only one instance of the controller may exist.

Author:
David Bahr

Field Detail

doneStartingTheApplication

public static boolean doneStartingTheApplication
Indicates whether or not we are done with the initial starting of the application. This is set to true when the initial setup procedure is completed.

currentlyRunningSetup

public static boolean currentlyRunningSetup
Indicates when the setupCA method is running

Method Detail

getInstanceOfCAController

public static CAController getInstanceOfCAController()
Gets the single instance of this controller (which runs everything).

getCAFrame

public static CAFrame getCAFrame()
Gets the frame that displays the graphics. This method is primarily for access by warning messages that need a parent component (so that the warning panels don't get lost).

analyzeData

public void analyzeData(int generation)
Invokes analyses of the CA data. To decide which analyses to run, iterates over a list of analyses.

Parameters:
generation - The generation being analyzed. In fact, there is no requirement that this be the generation analyzed, but it is the current generation of the CA.

clearLattice

public void clearLattice()
Clears all values from the lattice and updates the graphics to reflect this change.

delay

public void delay(long timeDelay)
Delays the program for the specified number of milliseconds. Useful when the graphics are moving or updating too quickly.

Parameters:
timeDelay - The delay in milliseconds.

endProgram

public void endProgram()
Makes sure the user wants to exit and then ends the program.

importGraphics

public void importGraphics()
Import new graphics. Note that this will means importing the graphics from a file, which must as a by-product also rebuild the lattice because the number of rows and columns may change.

incrementCA

public int incrementCA()
Steps the CA through a generation (a time step).

Returns:
generation The generation after the update is complete.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Indicates whether or not the simulation is running.

Returns:
true if the simulation is running.

loadData

public void loadData()
Load a data file onto the current CA without restarting.

loadImage

public void loadImage()
Load an image onto the current CA without restarting.

loadSimulation

public void loadSimulation(java.lang.String filePath)
Load a simulation into the CA, replacing the current CA.

Parameters:
filePath - The file that stores the new simulation.

pauseCA

public void pauseCA()
Temporarily stops the CA. Different from stopCA() because this sets a flag that remembers if the CA was running or stopped before it was asked to pause.

See Also:
unPauseCA()

print

public void print()
Prints the current graphics.

refreshCAGraphics

public void refreshCAGraphics()
Convenience method that updates the CA graphics, but only if the CA is stopped or if it is supposed to update at this time step. For example, if the CA is set to update only at the end, then this won't update the graphics unless the CA has stopped.
Similar to updateGraphicsPanel(), but updateGraphicsPanel() will always force an update.

resetAnalyses

public void resetAnalyses()
Resets the analyses without stopping them.

rewindCA

public void rewindCA()
If possible, steps the CA backwards by one generation. If not possible, nothing happens.

saveAsImage

public void saveAsImage()
Save the graphics image to a file (for example, JPEG).

saveData

public void saveData()
Save the data, if we've been asked to.

setMaxSteps

public void setMaxSteps(int maxSteps)
Set the maximum number of steps before the CA will stop.

Parameters:
maxSteps -

setTimeDelay

public void setTimeDelay(int timeDelay)
Set the delay between calculation of new generations.

Parameters:
timeDelay -

setUpdateGraphicsAtEnd

public void setUpdateGraphicsAtEnd(boolean atEnd)
Set whether or not the graphics will be updated at the end of the simulation.

Parameters:
atEnd - When true, the graphics will be updated only at the end of the simulation. When false, the graphics may be updated every generation or at a specified interval.

setUpdateGraphicsEveryNSteps

public void setUpdateGraphicsEveryNSteps(int interval)
Set the frequency with which the graphics will be updates.

Parameters:
interval - The graphics will be updated whenever the generation is a multiple of this interval.

setViewChanged

public void setViewChanged(boolean viewChanged)
Indicates whether or not the view has changed. When true, the graphics will "updateFastDrawingColorArray" at the next time step.

Parameters:
viewChanged - When true, the graphics will "updateFastDrawingColorArray" at the next time step.

setupCA

public void setupCA()
Instantiates everything needed for a simulation. In particular, sets up the lattice, graphics, rule, etcetera for the cellular automaton.

startAnalysis

public void startAnalysis(Analysis analysis)
Starts up the specified analysis (actually adds it to a list of analyses that are run every time the CA increments to a new generation).

Parameters:
analysis - The Analysis that will be started.

startCAInThread

public void startCAInThread()
Starts the CA in a separate thread. Use this when a call to startCA needs to return immediately so that some other method can return (without getting hung indefinitely in startCA().

stopAllAnalyses

public static void stopAllAnalyses()
Stops all of the analyses. Called when the program is exiting.

stopAnalysis

public void stopAnalysis(Analysis analysis)
Stops the specified analysis (actually removes it from a list of analyses that are run every time the CA increments to a new generation).

Parameters:
analysis - The Analysis that will be stopped.

stopCA

public void stopCA()
Stops the simulation.

unPauseCA

public void unPauseCA()
Restarts the CA, but only if the CA was running when pauseCA() was called. If the CA was not paused, or if the CA was stopped or started after it was paused, then this method does nothing.

See Also:
pauseCA()

updateGraphicsPanel

public void updateGraphicsPanel()
Update only the graphics panel -- but note that this means also setting the lattice and properties to make sure that CAGraphics isn't using local copies.

setUserSelectedNumberOfProcessors

public void setUserSelectedNumberOfProcessors(int numberOfProcessors)
Sets the number of processors that will be used for parallel processing. Once this is reset, if it does not equal the numberOfAvailableProcessors, then the code will create a new set of threads with this number.

Parameters:
numberOfProcessors - The number of processors selected by the user that will be used for parallel processing.
